channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Walking the rightsizing walk, part 3: 8 items to get rid of for sure
item.description: I am so embarrassed. All these columns and books I have written on downsizing and decluttering and my oh my, the mess I am in. Moving is the ultimate truth test. As I pack up the house my husband, DC, and I have lived in for eight years, box towers line the halls, packed and stacked like big city skylines. Each room coughs up its contents like a kid with consumption. I fear I may never see a clear counter again.

item.title: Who won 'Bachelor in Paradise' finale? See who got the cash prize
item.description: For the first time ever, two couples took home a significant chunk of change on the“Bachelor in Paradise” season 10 finale, which aired on Tuesday, Sept. 2.

item.title: Top 5 things to do in Sarasota-Manatee this weekend: Sept. 4-7
item.description: September may be Sarasota’s slowest month forlocal events, but there are still plenty of reasons to get out — includingthe start of the 2025 NFL season.

item.title: HS ROUNDUP: Three boys golfers shoot under par to lead Sarasota to win
item.description: A roundup of high school sports contests played the week of Sept. 1-6, 2025, in Manatee and Sarasota counties.If you don't see your results, have your coach email them tohtincoming@gmail.com

item.title: High School Football: Week 3 Sarasota, Manatee game previews and predictions
item.description: Preview capsules and predictions for high school football games being played by Sarasota and Manatee County teams on Friday, Sept. 5, 2025

item.title: Space Command's move, Artemis control and 3I/Atlas…
item.description: This week on SpaceBeat, host Rob Landers and space team reporter Eric Lagatta discuss President Trump's decision to move U.S. Space Command to Alabama. Other topics include the new Artemis control room at Johnson Space Center and NASA's objective to get a closer look at the interstellar object 3I/Atlas.

item.title: When does fall start? There are two answers. What to know
item.description: With the arrival ofpumpkin spiceandSpirit Halloweenin Florida over the last weeks, some might be wondering if it is actually fall?

item.description: Live from New York, it's almost time forSaturday Night Live!

item.title: Powerball jackpot for next drawing third largest ever…
item.description: Nobody won the$1.4 billion Powerball jackpoton Sept. 3.

item.title: See spaghetti models for Invest 91L. What Florida…
item.description: The National Hurricane Center designated a tropical wave in the eastern Atlantic as Invest 91L, Thursday afternoon, Sept. 4.

item.title: Bradenton man arrested for second-degree murder in death of girlfriend
item.description: Manatee County deputies arrested a 33-year-old on Sept. 3 for the second-degree murder of his girlfriend.

item.title: Community leaders have mixed emotions on SCS board appointment
item.description: Karen Rose’s return to the Sarasota County School Board — throughappointment by Gov. Ron DeSantisless than a year after she lost her seat in an election — is drawing mixed reactions from board members and education advocates who are weighing what her presence could mean for classrooms, families and district stability.

item.title: Battle on the right: Florida-based Newsmax takes Fox News to court
item.description: Two of the largestright-wing TV outletsare battling their claims over being the nation's top right-leaning news source inMiami's federal court.

item.title: How may PGT's parent firm's plant closures affect Venice, Fort Myers?
item.description: A “strategic realignment” of Florida operations bythe parent company of PGT Innovationsmeans closure of window and door manufacturing plants in South Florida's Medley and Hialeah, with some of the work shifting to PGT facilities in Venice and Fort Myers.

item.title: Florida's Alligator Alcatraz detention site to stay open for now, court rules
item.description: Gov. Ron DeSantis hailed a Sept. 4 appeals court ruling allowing — for the moment — operations to continue at theAlligator Alcatrazimmigration detention center.
